summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Senior Special Agent Dennis Lyeson with Federal Bureau of Prisons employee Brianna Rose Burton on August 5, 2021, as part of the OIG investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. Burton, a general maintenance worker, is questioned about her role, knowledge of camera system issues, and any involvement or information regarding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Dennis Lyeson
persons.context: Conducts the voluntary interview of Brianna Rose Burton as part of the OIG investigation into Epstein's death. He reads the warnings, administers the oath, and asks the majority of the questions.

persons.name: Brianna Rose Burton
persons.context: The witness being interviewed. She is a BOP employee at the MCC with 13 years of service, working in general maintenance and previously as a facility assistant. She states she had no direct interactions with Epstein and no knowledge of camera malfunctions prior to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation. The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding his death by hanging in the MCC's SHU (Special Housing Unit) on August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: John Hodge
persons.context: Mentioned by Burton as another communications technician at the MCC, possibly hired after August 2019.

connections.description: Lyeson is the OIG special agent formally interviewing Burton as a witness in the investigation.
Burton was a BOP employee at the MCC where Epstein was housed. She states she saw him from a distance in the SHU but had no direct interactions.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC's Special Housing Unit (Nine South). The interview investigates the circumstances, including camera malfunctions.

events.title: OIG Interview of Brianna Burton
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with BOP employee Brianna Rose Burton regarding the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Camera system drive failure reported
events.description: According to a service request read during the interview, a technician reported two bad drives on the NICE Vision Pro NVR unit on this date.

events.title: Attempt to repair camera system drives
events.description: A technician gained access to the DVR room and attempted to replace failed drives, which led to a corrupted video database during the rebuild process.

locations: Nine South (SHU - Special Housing Unit) at MCC
28632 Roadside Drive, Suite 285, Agoura Hills, CA 91301 (Resolute Documentation Services)
keyFacts: The interview is part of the official DOJ OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and the surrounding circumstances at the MCC.

Brianna Rose Burton, a BOP general maintenance worker, states she had no involvement with Epstein, did not work on August 10, 2019, and was unaware of any camera system problems at the MCC in August 2019.

The agent references a service request (#24975) detailing camera system failures: bad drives were reported on August 8, 2019, replacement was attempted on August 10, and improper shutdown during repair corrupted the video database.
Burton states that if a camera problem had been reported to her while she was acting supervisor, she would have escalated it and instructed it to be fixed immediately, not left for the next day.

Multiple names of BOP staff (supervisors, managers, technicians) are referenced in the context of who might have been responsible for or informed about the camera issues, but their names are redacted in the transcript.
